result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co cases 15CM75 and 15CM309, with the same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain at least part-time employment or pursue a course of education
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No Contact with D.W.

The Court will consider modifying the No Contact if def is doing well and free from probation violations.  A letter can be written to this Court for a review of the No contact if it is requested
.

Undergo a Domestic Abuse assessment if a new one is needed and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Attend Domestic Court Reviews - the first Hearing is on 6-23-15 at 4:00 pm in Br 5

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

No sentence credit if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay Court financial obligations as originally ordered

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
